episodeTitle: The Straw Hats Defeated?! Hordy Gains Control of the Ryugu Palace!
episodeTitleJapanese: 一味敗北！？ホーディ竜宮城制圧
description: Hody Jones recovers from Zoro's attack using Energy Steroids and captures King Neptune along with Zoro, Usopp, and Brook at Ryugu Palace. Meanwhile, Luffy's group reaches the Sea Forest where they reunite with Franky and meet Jinbe for the first time in two years.

events.title: Zoro Cuts Hody Jones
events.description: Roronoa Zoro slashes Hody Jones with his sword, rendering him unconscious temporarily. This attack demonstrates Zoro's post-timeskip strength against the leader of the New Fish-Man Pirates.
events.significance: Shows Zoro's improved abilities after the two-year training with Mihawk, but also sets up Hody's dependence on Energy Steroids to continue fighting.

events.title: Hody Uses Energy Steroid to Recover
events.description: After being defeated by Zoro, one of Hody's subordinates gives him an Energy Steroid pill. Hody consumes it and immediately recovers from his wounds, demonstrating the dangerous power of these performance-enhancing drugs.
events.significance: First major demonstration of Energy Steroids' instant healing and power-boosting effects in battle. This establishes the threat level of Hody and foreshadows the consequences of Energy Steroid abuse.

quotes.text: Energy Steroids can instantly revitalize the body!
quotes.speaker: New Fish-Man Pirate
quotes.context: Explaining the effects as Hody takes the pill

events.title: Neptune and Straw Hats Captured
events.description: King Neptune attempts to flee Ryugu Palace with Zoro, Usopp, and Brook using his whale Hoe, but the revitalized Hody Jones intercepts and captures them all. The two Ministers and palace guards manage to escape.
events.significance: Major turning point where Hody Jones successfully takes control of Ryugu Palace and captures the king, establishing him as a serious threat and forcing the Straw Hats to mount a rescue operation.

events.title: Luffy's Group Arrives at Sea Forest
events.description: Luffy, Shirahoshi, Chopper, and Sanji reach the Sea Forest, where they find Franky working on the Thousand Sunny with Den, Tom's younger brother who is coating the ship.
events.significance: Reunites part of the Straw Hat crew and brings them to an important location containing historical poneglyphs and the ship they need for their journey.

quotes.text: He's the master who is going to coat your younger brother, huh?
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy misunderstanding Franky's explanation about Den and the ship coating

events.title: Luffy and Jinbe Reunion After Two Years
events.description: Luffy and Jinbe meet for the first time since the war at Marineford, two years prior. Their reunion is joyful, with Jinbe expressing happiness at seeing Luffy has grown stronger and recovered from his trauma.
events.significance: Important reunion between two characters who bonded during the Impel Down and Marineford arcs. This meeting sets up Jinbe's eventual recruitment into the Straw Hat Pirates and shows Luffy's emotional growth.

events.title: Discovery of Injured Hachi
events.description: Jinbe is shocked to see Hatchan severely injured, covered in arrows from Vander Decken IX's attacks. Despite his injuries and heavy blood loss, Hachi managed to swim back to warn the Straw Hats about Hody's invasion.
events.significance: Demonstrates Hachi's loyalty to the Straw Hats and the danger posed by Vander Decken IX's Devil Fruit powers. Also shows Jinbe's concern for his old friend.

events.title: Nami and Camie Arrive with Palace News
events.description: Nami and Camie arrive at the Sea Forest bringing the devastating news about what happened at Ryugu Palace - that Hody Jones has taken control and captured Neptune, Zoro, Usopp, and Brook.
events.significance: Provides critical information to Luffy and sets up the conflict that will drive the rest of the arc, leading to the battle for Fish-Man Island.

events.title: Jinbe Apologizes for Arlong's Rampage
events.description: Jinbe apologizes to the Straw Hats, particularly to Nami, for his role in allowing Arlong to terrorize the East Blue. He explains that after becoming a Warlord, he released Arlong from captivity, which led to Arlong taking over Nami's village.
events.significance: Critical emotional moment that connects the Fish-Man Island arc to the Arlong Park arc. Establishes Jinbe's sense of responsibility and sets up his deeper relationship with the crew, particularly Nami. This begins the backstory revelations that will continue in following episodes.

events.title: Brook's Post-Timeskip Eyecatcher Debut
events.description: This episode features Brook's post-timeskip eyecatcher for the first time, showing his updated design after the two-year training period.
events.significance: Completes the set of post-timeskip eyecatchers for all Straw Hat crew members, highlighting Brook's visual changes including his rock star persona.

quotes.text: He's the master who is going to coat your younger brother, huh?
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy misunderstanding Franky's explanation about Den coating the Thousand Sunny

themes.description: Jinbe's apology for Arlong's actions demonstrates his deep sense of responsibility for the consequences of his past decisions, even those he couldn't directly control.
themes.symbolism: The meeting at the Sea Forest, a place of historical significance and memory, serves as an appropriate setting for confronting past sins and seeking forgiveness.

themes.description: Hody's reliance on Energy Steroids to defeat his enemies shows the dangerous allure of artificial power enhancement and foreshadows the consequences of such shortcuts.
themes.symbolism: The Energy Steroids represent the corrupting influence of hatred and the willingness to destroy oneself for revenge.

themes.description: The reunion between Luffy and Jinbe after two years highlights how both have grown since their traumatic experiences at Marineford.
themes.symbolism: The Sea Forest, where ships go to die, represents both endings and new beginnings as the crew prepares for their journey into the New World.

characterSpotlights.development: Jinbe confronts his past mistakes and seeks forgiveness from the Straw Hats, particularly Nami, for his indirect role in her suffering under Arlong's rule.
keyActions: Reunites with Luffy after two years
Expresses shock at seeing Shirahoshi outside the tower
Apologizes to the Straw Hats for Arlong's rampage in East Blue

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates his willingness to use Energy Steroids to achieve his goals, establishing him as a dangerous threat who will stop at nothing.
keyActions: Takes an Energy Steroid after being defeated by Zoro
Captures King Neptune, Zoro, Usopp, and Brook

characterSpotlights.development: Shows emotional maturity and joy at reuniting with Jinbe, demonstrating his growth since Marineford.
keyActions: Arrives at the Sea Forest with Shirahoshi
Meets Jinbe for the first time in two years
Receives news about his captured crew members
quotes: He's the master who is going to coat your younger brother, huh?

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded several scenes with additional reaction shots and extended dialogue during the palace invasion sequence.
Additional animation sequences showing the palace guards' escape and the Ministers' reactions to the invasion.

trivia.fact: This is the first episode to feature Brook's post-timeskip eyecatcher, completing the set for all nine Straw Hat crew members.
Episode 538 adapts only pages 2-17 of Chapter 619, showing the detailed pacing approach Toei was using during the Fish-Man Island arc.
The episode was simulcast by Funimation one day before the Japanese broadcast, which was unusual for the time.
Den is voiced by the same actor who voiced his brother Tom in earlier episodes, maintaining the family connection.
